title: Robin van Persie questions "struggling" Ole Gunnar Solskjaer after latest Man Utd defeat
text:

Former Man Utd striker Robin van Persie has questioned whether Ole Gunnar Solskjaer knows how man-manage his squad following the defeat to Newcastle .

United lost their third game of the season after a poor display at St James' Park on Sunday.

A debut goal from Newcastle's Matty Longstaff proved to be the difference between the sides, but the manner of the defeat raised suspicions over Solskjaer's suitability as United manager.

The Norwegian apologised to the club's fans in his post-match interview, admitting his side were low on confidence, and he 'needed to sort their heads out'.

But van Persie has criticised Solskjaer's comments, and suggested he was not the man to turn United's fortunes around.

(Image: REUTERS)

"You can see he’s struggling there, if I’m really honest, during that interview," Van Persie told Optus Sport.

"And I get it if you’re manager of Manchester United during this period of time.

"So he’s searching for words, maybe he chose a few wrong ones there.

"Because as a player, what does that mean? ‘Sorting the players’ heads out’, what does that mean?

(Image: Getty Images)

"If you’re a player you’re a little bit like, ‘my head is fine’.

"Even though you can see the players are low in confidence, he needs to find a way to reconnect again and to get their confidence high.

"As a manager, when your team is low in confidence, get them up. When your team is too high in confidence, when they are becoming a little bit too much, you have to get them back to the middle again.

"At the moment, based on this interview, and based on what I’ve seen in the game, I’m not sure if he really knows how to find the buttons there."

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Sky Sports pundit Jamie Redknapp was also unsure of Solskjaer's attributes for the role in his analysis, as United slipped to 12th with just eight points from eight games.

"Whatever way you dress this up, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is a very lucky man to get this job," Redknapp said.

"He managed Molde and he managed Cardiff . Is that really the credentials to manage one of the biggest clubs in the world? I don’t think so.

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

"Do you give him time? There comes a point where if this carries on, you can’t, it is impossible. But the problem is, who is out there right now better than him?

"If you didn’t know any better the next man you would be looking at is Jose Mourinho, and he had a go at it and he failed. This is a very difficult job right now."

United now have a brief respite from their difficult patch due to the international break, but return to Premier League action on October 20 against rivals and league leaders Liverpool , who are looking to maintain their perfect start to the campaign.
description: Solskjaer was held to account for United's dismal showing at St James' Park but van Persie criticised his comments
